column5: For the next few days before and after the trout opener, the water condition will most likely be very clear. My ultimate goal for stealheading is trying to avoid using fish roe completely.  So I decided to tie some natural/realistic looking flies, I started with stone fly.   Speil inspired, but I think mine looks more like a crossbreed between a crayfish and a scorpion   And hopefully I can fool steelheads like this one with my new creations
nice work! good luck out there.
I'm both impressed and flattered.I think they look awesome and I've no doubt the trout will too.
Nice work, I am sure the trout will think so also.  Dan
Nice ties man!  What'd ya use for the legs?  Those should be good for resident trout as well, if you fish for those too!
way to go young one. thats a nice fish.
Very impressive young_one. I'm guessing your legs are raffia or swiss straw tied and trimmed, thats a lot of work but they make an awesome realistic looking fly fly. I hope they work well for you.
Awesome work young_one Good luck on your trout hunt Leechman
Those are really excellent. Makes me want to get back into tying flies
